status.name: Open

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] Building of Arrow C++ (dataset) errors on Windows

comments.body:
[~westonpace] Can someone take a look here?

Ideally {{ScanV2Options}} should not use inheritance for this. You can use composition internally but keep {{ScanV2Options}} a standalone struct.
Also [~benpharkins] this may be approachable for you.

This isn't new exactly.  {{WriteNodeOptions}} and {{ScanNodeOptions}} have the same problem and have been around for a while.

That being said, {{ExecNodeOptions}} is a rather useless base class.  It is really just a marker interface.  In Acero we need to be able to define a generic node declaration as "name + some kind of options thing".  I suspect it has only been kept around due to FUD around {{void*}} (or, more accurately, it would probably be {{shared_ptr<void>}}).  I'd be fine with getting rid of it.

I would say a marker interface can be useful for documentation at least.
I would also be surprised if it didn't have at least a {{ToString()}} virtual method, since you generally want that for nice diagnostics/debug printing.
